d: Node.js v10
k: prerequisites node

d: Ready-compiled sharp and libvips binaries are provided for use with Node.js v10 on the most common platforms macOS x64 10.13 Linux x64 glibc
k: prebuilt binaries ready compiled sharp libvips binaries provided node most common platforms macos linux glibc

d: The architecture and platform of Node.js used for npm install must be the same as the architecture and platform of Node.js used at runtime.
k: common problems architecture platform node used npm install must same architecture platform node used runtime

d: To use a custom, globally-installed version of libvips instead of the provided binaries, make sure it is at least the version listed under c
k: custom libvips custom globally installed version libvips instead provided binaries make sure least version listed under

d: This module will be compiled from source at npm install time when a globally-installed libvips is detected set the SHARP_IGNORE_GLOBAL_LIBVI
k: building source module compiled source npm install time globally installed libvips detected sharpignoregloballibvi

d: This is an advanced approach that most people will not require. To install the prebuilt libvips binaries from a custom URL, set the sharp_di
k: custom prebuilt binaries advanced approach most people require install prebuilt libvips binaries custom url sharpdi

d: The vips package must be installed before npm install is run. sh pkg install -y pkgconf vips sh cd /usr/ports/graphics/vips/ make install cl
k: freebsd vips package must installed before npm install run pkg install pkgconf vips usr ports graphics vips make install

d: Add the jemalloc buildpack to reduce the effects of memory fragmentation. Set NODE_MODULES_CACHE
k: heroku add jemalloc buildpack reduce effects memory fragmentation nodemodulescache

d: Set the Lambda runtime to nodejs12.x. The binaries in the node_modules directory of the deployment package must be for the Linux x64 platfor
k: aws lambda lambda runtime nodejs binaries nodemodules directory deployment package must linux platfor

d: Electron provides versions of the V8 JavaScript engine that are incompatible with Node.js. To ensure the correct binaries are used, run the
k: electron electron provides versions javascript engine incompatible node ensure correct binaries used run

d: Constructor
k: sharp constructor

d: Take a snapshot of the Sharp instance, returning a new instance. Cloned instances inherit the input of their parent instance. This allows mu
k: clone take snapshot sharp instance returning new instance cloned instances inherit input parent instance allows

d: Fast access to uncached image metadata without decoding any compressed image data. A Promise is returned when callback is not provided.
k: metadata fast access uncached image metadata without decoding compressed image data promise returned callback provided

d: Access to pixel-derived image statistics for every channel in the image. A Promise is returned when callback is not provided.
k: stats access pixel derived image statistics every channel image promise returned callback provided

d: Write output image data to a file.
k: tofile write output image data file

d: Write output to a Buffer. JPEG, PNG, WebP, TIFF and RAW output are supported.
k: tobuffer write output buffer jpeg png webp tiff raw output supported

d: Include all metadata EXIF, XMP, IPTC from the input image in the output image. The default behaviour, when withMetadata is not used, is to s
k: withmetadata include metadata exif xmp iptc input image output image default behaviour withmetadata used

d: Force output to a given format.
k: toformat force output given format

d: Use these JPEG options for output image.
k: jpeg jpeg options output image

d: Use these PNG options for output image.
k: png png options output image

d: Use these WebP options for output image.
k: webp webp options output image

d: Use these TIFF options for output image.
k: tiff tiff options output image

d: Use these HEIF options for output image.
k: heif heif options output image

d: Force output to be raw, uncompressed, 8-bit unsigned integer unit8 pixel data. Pixel ordering is left-to-right, top-to-bottom, without paddi
k: raw force output raw uncompressed bit unsigned integer unit pixel data pixel ordering left right top bottom without paddi

d: Use tile-based deep zoom image pyramid output. Set the format and options for tile images via the toFormat, jpeg, png or webp functions. Use
k: tile tile based deep zoom image pyramid output format options tile images via toformat jpeg png webp functions

d: Resize image to width, height or width x height.
k: resize resize image width height width height

d: Extends/pads the edges of the image with the provided background colour. This operation will always occur after resizing and extraction, if
k: extend extends pads edges image provided background colour operation occur after resizing extraction

d: Extract/crop a region of the image.
k: extract extract crop region image

d: Trim boring pixels from all edges that contain values similar to the top-left pixel. Images consisting entirely of a single colour will calc
k: trim trim boring pixels edges contain values similar top left pixel images consisting entirely single colour calc

d: Composite images over the processed resized, extracted etc. image.
k: composite composite images processed resized extracted image

d: Rotate the output image by either an explicit angle or auto-orient based on the EXIF Orientation tag.
k: rotate rotate output image explicit angle auto orient based exif orientation tag

d: Flip the image about the vertical Y axis. This always occurs after rotation, if any. The use of flip implies the removal of the EXIF Orienta
k: flip flip image vertical axis occurs after rotation flip implies removal exif orienta

d: Flop the image about the horizontal X axis. This always occurs after rotation, if any. The use of flop implies the removal of the EXIF Orien
k: flop flop image horizontal axis occurs after rotation flop implies removal exif orien

d: Sharpen the image. When used without parameters, performs a fast, mild sharpen of the output image. When a sigma is provided, performs a slo
k: sharpen sharpen image used without parameters performs fast mild sharpen output image sigma provided performs slo

d: Apply median filter. When used without parameters the default window is 3x3.
k: median apply median filter used without parameters default window

d: Blur the image. When used without parameters, performs a fast, mild blur of the output image. When a sigma is provided, performs a slower, m
k: blur blur image used without parameters performs fast mild blur output image sigma provided performs slower

d: Merge alpha transparency channel, if any, with a background.
k: flatten merge alpha transparency channel background

d: Apply a gamma correction by reducing the encoding darken pre-resize at a factor of 1/gamma then increasing the encoding brighten post-resize
k: gamma apply gamma correction reducing encoding darken pre resize factor gamma then increasing encoding brighten post resize

d: Produce the negative of the image.
k: negate produce negative image

d: Enhance output image contrast by stretching its luminance to cover the full dynamic range.
k: normalise enhance output image contrast stretching luminance cover full dynamic range

d: Alternative spelling of normalise.
k: normalize alternative spelling normalise

d: Convolve the image with the specified kernel.
k: convolve convolve image specified kernel

d: Any pixel value greather than or equal to the threshold value will be set to 255, otherwise it will be set to 0.
k: threshold pixel value greather than equal threshold value otherwise

d: Perform a bitwise boolean operation with operand image.
k: boolean perform bitwise boolean operation operand image

d: Apply the linear formula a input b to the image levels adjustment
k: linear apply linear formula input image levels adjustment

d: Recomb the image with the specified matrix.
k: recomb recomb image specified matrix

d: Transforms the image using brightness, saturation and hue rotation.
k: modulate transforms image brightness saturation hue rotation

d: Remove alpha channel, if any. This is a no-op if the image does not have an alpha channel.
k: removealpha remove alpha channel image alpha channel

d: Ensure alpha channel, if missing. The added alpha channel will be fully opaque. This is a no-op if the image already has an alpha channel.
k: ensurealpha ensure alpha channel missing added alpha channel fully opaque image alpha channel

d: Extract a single channel from a multi-channel image.
k: extractchannel extract single channel multi channel image

d: Join one or more channels to the image. The meaning of the added channels depends on the output colourspace, set with toColourspace. By defa
k: joinchannel join one channels image meaning added channels depends output colourspace tocolourspace defa

d: Perform a bitwise boolean operation on all input image channels bands to produce a single channel output image.
k: bandbool perform bitwise boolean operation input image channels bands produce single channel output image

d: Tint the image using the provided chroma while preserving the image luminance. An alpha channel may be present and will be unchanged by the
k: tint tint image provided chroma while preserving image luminance alpha channel present unchanged

d: Convert to 8-bit greyscale 256 shades of grey. This is a linear operation. If the input image is in a non-linear colour space such as sRGB,
k: greyscale convert bit greyscale shades grey linear operation input image non linear colour space such srgb

d: Alternative spelling of greyscale.
k: grayscale alternative spelling greyscale

d: Set the output colourspace. By default output image will be web-friendly sRGB, with additional channels interpreted as alpha channels.
k: tocolourspace output colourspace default output image web friendly srgb additional channels interpreted alpha channels

d: Alternative spelling of toColourspace.
k: tocolorspace alternative spelling tocolourspace

d: An Object containing nested boolean values representing the available input and output formats/methods.
k: format object containing nested boolean values representing available input output formats methods

d: An Object containing the version numbers of libvips and its dependencies.
k: versions object containing version numbers libvips dependencies

d: Gets or, when options are provided, sets the limits of _libvips_ operation cache. Existing entries in the cache will be trimmed after any ch
k: cache options provided limits libvips operation cache existing entries cache trimmed after

d: Gets or, when a concurrency is provided, sets the number of threads _libvips_ should create to process each image. The default value is the
k: concurrency concurrency provided number threads libvips create process image default value

d: An EventEmitter that emits a change event when a task is either
k: queue eventemitter emits change event task

d: Provides access to internal task counters.
k: counters provides access internal task counters

d: Get and set use of SIMD vector unit instructions. Requires libvips to have been compiled with liborc support.
k: simd simd vector unit instructions requires libvips compiled liborc support
